org.jchassis.termctl
Class Keystroke

java.lang.Object
  org.jchassis.termctl.Keystroke

public class Keystroke
extends java.lang.Object

Keystroke definitions. These are used for keystroke events.

Keystroke

public Keystroke(Key key)
Creates a single key keystroke.

Parameters:
key - the key that was pressed

Keystroke

public Keystroke(Key key,
                 ModifierKey modifier)
Creates a two key keystroke.

Parameters:
key - the key that was pressed
modifier - the modifier that was simultaneously pressed

Keystroke

public Keystroke(Key key,
                 ModifierKey modifier1,
                 ModifierKey modifier2)
Creates a three key keystroke.

Parameters:
key - the key that was pressed
modifier1 - the modifier that was simultaneously pressed
modifier2 - the modifier that was simultaneously pressed

getKey

public Key getKey()
Gets the (non-modifier) key that was pressed.

Returns:
the key

isModified

public boolean isModified()
Indicates whether any modifier keys were pressed.

Returns:
true if one or more modifier keys were pressed; false otherwise

hasModifier

public boolean hasModifier(ModifierKey modifier)
Tests if a particular modifier key was pressed.

Parameters:
modifier - the modifier key to test for
Returns:
true if the key was pressed; false otherwise

getModifierCount

public int getModifierCount()
Gets the number of modifier keys pressed.

Returns:
the number of modifier keys pressed

getFirstModifier

public ModifierKey getFirstModifier()
Gets the first modifier key.

Returns:
the modifier key; or null if no modifier was pressed

getSecondModifier

public ModifierKey getSecondModifier()
Gets the second modifier key.

Returns:
the modifier key; or null if one or less modifiers were pressed

getThirdModifier

public ModifierKey getThirdModifier()
Gets the third modifier key.

Returns:
the modifier key; or null if two or less modifiers were pressed
